title: Roots
excerpt: They dig deep, unseen fingers clutching the dark heart of the soil, anchoring the giant against the storm...
body:
They dig deep,
Unseen fingers clutching
The dark heart of the soil.
Anchoring the giant against the storm.

We see the leaves dancing,
The branches reaching for the sun,
But the war is fought below.
In the cold, damp earth,
Where strength is born
In the quiet dark.
